name: The Quotable Seven Quiz | Television | 15 Questions

questions.text: In what episode did Vin make the remark, "Josiah, you silver-tongued devil"?
questions.explanation:
The Trial.

	Josiah was defending Nathan's father in his trial and had given an eloquent closing argument to which Vin made his remark.

questions.text: As they were laying a coffin in the ground in "The Old West" and J.D. wanted to say a prayer, Vin told J.D. "It's a coffin full of _____".
questions.explanation:
Rocks.

	Vin, J.D., Chris, and Mary wanted some outlaws to believe Judge Travis had died of a gunshot wound. J.D. filled a coffin full of rocks so they could bury it. When they lowered it to the ground, J.D. thought they should say a prayer or something over the coffin and that's when Vin made the above mentioned line.

questions.text: While putting bullets in his gun who said, "I'm not going anywhere. I haven't shot anyone yet"?
questions.explanation:
J.D.

	The pilot episode was a two hour episode that introduced the seven to the TV screen. J.D. Dunne was the youngest of the seven and considered the greenhorn of the group.

questions.text: What was the name of the episode that had a woman telling Buck, "You're not like the others" to which Buck replied, "I was told I was one of a kind"?
questions.explanation:
The Ladykillers.

	Buck was seeing a female bounty hunter off named Kate when she made this remark about Buck. Kate had never had any good experiences with men, but Buck was different.

questions.text: "___________ got to be growed into, Sonny". What is the missing word from J.D.'s statement in "Manhunt"?
questions.explanation:
Reputation.

	J.D. made this comment to a missionary's son in "Manhunt" when the son was talking about how he was as good as the seven.

questions.text: As Ezra, Nathan and J.D. are standing in town in "Serpents", Ezra told them, "When it comes right down to it I do believe Chris thinks I'm a larsenist". J.D. answered with, "No, Ezra, I just don't think he trusts you with money".
questions.explanation:
True.

	The definition of larceny is the stealing of another person's property. J.D. was essentially repeating what Ezra had said. In the end, Ezra stole the money which later saved his life when he stepped in front of a bullet meant for Mary Travis and the money slowed the bullet.

questions.text: "I'm probably going to get myself killed now I got to worry about a new job too". Which one of the seven had this as his first line on the series?
questions.explanation:
Vin.

	Vin was working at the store across from the saloon the first time he saw Chris Larabee. Together the two of them went after Nathan Jackson, who was moments away from being hanged.

questions.text: As Ezra was riding out of an unknown town in "The New Law", he remarked to the six, "Never ______ with an entire clan."
questions.explanation:
Gamble.

	Chris and the others were coming to get Ezra so they could ride back to protect the town. As they were headed into the town, Ezra was riding out. He made this remark to Chris after he asked Ezra where he was going.

questions.text: Which one of the seven made the remark to a hired gun, "You sure do use big words for someone so stupid"?
questions.explanation:
Chris.

	In "Nemesis", Chris insulted the hired gun Fowler after Chris made him believe he was drunk and out of control. Fowler killed himself by walking into a burning stable before he could tell Chris who hired him to kill Sarah and Adam Larabee.

questions.text: From what episode did Josiah say, "Now that there's divine intervention. Me, I was gonna shoot your hand off"?
questions.explanation:
Nemesis.

	Josiah and Nathan were with John Blackfox when Josiah laid down his gun to go for his rifle. Nathan threw his knife to keep Blackfox away from the gun.

questions.text: When Chris told the others they were going to have to make a show of force to get Guy Royal to back off the homesteaders in "The Collector", who commented, "Show of force is my middle name"?
questions.explanation:
Buck.

	"The Collector" was Tim Thomerson's first appearance on "The Magnificent Seven". He later appeared in "The New Law" as the same person.

questions.text: Which one of the seven told a horse, "Sometimes this animal magnetism; it's a curse"?
questions.explanation:
Buck.

	Buck had a father warn him off his daughter in "Witness" and Buck turned around and made this comment to a horse.

questions.text: When the sheriff from Eagle Bend replied, "I heard you're fast." Which one of the seven answered with, "I heard that too."
questions.explanation:
Chris.

	The seven protected Nathan's father from a lynch mob in "The Trial". Eagle Bend's Sheriff Staines made the above mentioned comment to Chris and Chris answered him with a smile on his face.

questions.text: While sitting on a hill, Josiah prayed, "Oh, Lord, I know you're out there. Give me a sign. Talk to me. (hears hoof beats). Bet you thought that was funny huh? What kind of sign is this?" From episode does this quote originate?
questions.explanation:
The New Law.

	When the seven broke up, they went their separate ways. Only when Mary came to tell Chris the town was being taken over, did Chris rally the seven together again. They found Josiah on top of a hill praying.

questions.text: When Ezra asked, "What does every visitor want to do here?" in the episode "Sins of the Past", what was Nathan's answer?
questions.explanation:
Leave.

	Ezra finally raised enough money to buy the saloon, but found himself in competition with his mother who bought the hotel across from the saloon.
